text:

title: Heron Island Research Project
text:
While studying abroad at the University of Queensland, I lived at the university owned Heron Island research station. While here, I conducted my own research project looking at the effects on fish mobility and feeding patterns of a man-made sea wall that was added to the Great Barrier Reef.
My paper is embedded below. Read on if interested!

title: My Work With the Surfrider Foundation
text:
The Surfrider Foundation is a nonprofit organization dedicated to the protection and enjoyment of the world’s oceans, waves, and beaches for all people, supported by a powerful activist network. I have been involved with the organization for the past seven years and remain deeply aligned with its goals- from reducing plastic pollution and promoting beach access to protecting clean water. Please continue reading to learn more about my work with the foundation.


2025-present
The Surfrider Foundation Isla Vista club is one of the most active Surfrider student clubs in the world, and among the largest environmental organizations at UCSB. Our club is made up of 125 members and 9 committees. I served as vice president for a year before being elected co-president. My duties and accomplishments in this role include:

Increasing club membership by 20% during my vice presidency
Collaborating with local brand Island View Outfitters to create a Surfrider-themed collection to raise awareness and funds for our cause
Helping to collect over 1,000 dollars worth of prizes for our annual Concert for the Coast fundraiser
Planning speaker events with famous world champion surfers, local business owners, and artists
Handling club communications, outreach to local businesses and national partners, and recruitment in the fall




2025-present
Selected into a group of 14 Surfrider club leaders from across the country.

Monthly meetings and trainings to develop advocacy and leadership skills
Presented to legislators at Hill Day in Washington DC and California Oceans Day in Sacramento to advocate for bills that reduce plastic, restrict offshore drilling, and protect clean water.




2022-2024
Was admitted onto this committee during my freshman year at UCSB and served for a year before being elected vice-president.

Canvassed door-to-door to homes in Isla Vista to provide educational materials on recycling
Organized petition in support of reduced plastic usage at UCSB dining halls
Created weekly “Trash Talk Tuesday” posts to educate Instagram users about plastic and waste reduction
Designed sign to post at local beaches that displays the current water quality




2021-2022

Arranged beach cleanups, fundraising campaigns, and biweekly meetings with members



Contacted over fifty San Diego County restaurants to inform them about the Ocean Friendly Restaurants program. Successfully helped to implement this program in multiple restaurants to prioritize plastic reduction, proper recycling, and sustainable food practices.




2023 - present

Visits and contacts restaurants in San Diego County to inform them about the Ocean Friendly Restaurants program which helps transition eateries to more sustainable practices
Tables at events such as beach cleanups to bring awareness to this committee
Acted in a training video that is shown to future volunteers




2019

Corresponded with Skip the Plastic Norwalk
Represented the youth voice by petitioning, presenting, and speaking at city council meetings to successfully campaign for a plastic bag ban in New Canaan and Norwalk, CT

August - November 2024 The University of Queensland, Australia During this three month program, I gained valuable research and field study experience. I completed two research projects- one focused on fish-feeding patterns and the other on microplastic deposition in sediment. You can find more details about these studies in the projects tab. I also conducted field work in Lamington National Park and Carnarvon Gorge, where I developed practical skills such as species identification, quadrat sampling, and transect surveys.



Physics, chemistry, biology, oceanography, statistics and data science, calculus, agroecology

title: North Stradbroke Research Project
text:
While studying abroad at the University of Queensland, I had the opportunity to complete a research project while staying at the Moreton Bay Research Station on Minjerribah, North Stradbroke Island, Queensland.
The project studied the concentration of microplastics in sediment cores to determine whether the deposition in sediment has increased over time.
Please read the paper below to find out more.

title: Mary Holtam
text:
Welcome! Thank you for visiting my site.
I am a 3rd-year student at the University of California, Santa Barbara, pursuing a Bachelor’s of Science in Environmental Studies to drive change through science and policy. I am the president of the Isla Vista Surfrider Foundation and am passionate about the intersection between ocean accessibility, conservation, and the surf industry.
On this site, you’ll find more about my work, passions, and projects. Feel free to explore - and reach out if you’d like to collaborate or connect!
